text: Rich "Rock" Priske (August 29, 1967 - July 11, 2020) was a Canadian bassist. He was born in Vancouver, British Columbia. He played bass and/or written songs for Art Bergmann, DSK, ShoCore, Chrome Dog, Bif Naked and Real McKenzies, and others. Priske was most widely known for playing bass guitar and keyboards in the Canadian band Matthew Good Band from 1998 to 2002. He later played with Matthew Good until the end of the In a Coma tour in the fall of 2005. Priske died on July 11, 2020 from a heart attack, aged 52. ==References== Category:1967 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Canadian guitarists Category:Musicians from Vancouver
title: Rich Priske
